oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Black and white two-sided propaganda leaflet conveys the anguish of a mother as she cries over the image she envisions of her son, killed in fighting. The leaflet number is on the front (SP.2141). The reverse contains a list of eleven advantages/rewards; received from the government by surrendering. Fifteen million copies of this leaflet were printed in December of 1967. Portions of the front image and theme would be incorporated into another leaflet that would feature a lengthy, sentimental poem.

oai_dc:dc.dc:description: The Chieu Hoi (Open Arms) program represents a 10-year psychological operation launched by the South Vietnamese government in April 1963 to encourage the "return" or "rally" of Viet-Cong, North Vietnamese Army soldiers,; and Communist sympathizers. An estimated 160,000 defections occurred, but the program did not tend to sway hardcore Viet-Cong , North Vietnamese officers, or the more educated of enemy forces.
